channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Monkeys are on the loose in St. Louis, and AI-generated jokes are just slowing down animal control’s primate chase
item.description: “It's been a lot in regard to AI and what's genuine and what's not,” city health spokesperson Willie Springer. “People are just having fun.”

item.title: ‘Apple Intelligence,’ powered by Gemini, marks a ‘major validation moment for Google,’ top tech analyst says
item.description: The deal allowing Apple to tap into Google's AI technology was disclosed Monday in a joint statement from the Silicon Valley powerhouses.

item.title: Allegiant Air to acquire Sun Country Airlines for $1.5 billion
item.description: The airlines said travelers shouldn’t expect any immediate changes and can continue booking and flying with either carrier as they normally do.

item.title: What to Know About the Criminal Investigation of Fed Chair Jerome Powell
item.description: The Justice Department’s probe into whether Jerome H. Powell, the chair of the Federal Reserve, lied about renovations to the central bank’s headquart...

item.title: Paramount fires back at Warner Bros. bid, launching proxy fight for board seats at annual meeting
item.description: Paramount has also filed a lawsuit asking Warner Bros. Discovery to give more information about its merger agreement with Netflix.

item.title: Iran Says It Is Prepared for War but Ready to Negotiate After Trump’s Warnings
item.description: The comments came after President Trump said he was “ looking at some very strong options” to curb the Iranian authorities’ harsh repression of anti-g...

item.title: The Rare Republican Who Brawls With Trump — and Is Ready for More
item.description: Thomas Massie says his primary against a Trump-supported challenger will be a referendum on whether you can “have a thought that diverges from the pre...

item.title: Grok blocked in Malaysia and Indonesia as sexual deepfake scandal builds
item.description: Scrutiny of Grok is growing, including in the EU, India, France and the UK, which said Monday it was moving to criminalize “nudification apps.”

item.title: Federal Prosecutor Is Fired Amid Further Turmoil in Comey Case
item.description: Robert K. McBride had been serving as the top deputy to Lindsey Halligan, who has continued to act as the U.S. attorney for the Eastern District of Vi...

item.title: Trump’s Envoy to India Offers Hope Amid a Strained Relationship
item.description: Sergio Gor, a confidant of the U.S. president, took up his post as ambassador in New Delhi with ties between the countries at their lowest ebb in deca...

item.title: Iran Says It Is Prepared for War but Ready to Negotiate After Trump’s Warnings
item.description: The comments came after President Trump said he was “ looking at some very strong options” to curb the Iranian authorities’ harsh repression of anti-g...

item.title: Stocks, Bonds and the Dollar Fluctuate on Threat to Fed Chair Powell
item.description: Stocks and U.S. Treasuries were relatively unchanged on Monday, a sign investors don’t see an immediate threat to the economy.

item.title: World Court Hears Groundbreaking Genocide Case Against Myanmar
item.description: The case was brought to the World Court by a country not directly affected by the alleged genocide of the Rohingya, a precedent for similar claims aga...

item.title: Is Grass-Fed Beef Better?
item.description: The idea of cows grazing in a pasture seems idyllic. We asked experts how their emissions stack up compared to factory farms.

item.title: Deposed Shah’s Son Hopes Trump Will Put Iran Regime ‘Down for Good’
item.description: Reza Pahlavi, once the crown prince of Iran, says protesters there have been emboldened by President Trump suggesting that he could take military acti...
